author: @aritratalapatra8452
text: There is a difference between non-technical and non-programming jobs. Something which does not involve computer programming cannot be tagged as "Non-tech". MPFi is a technology used in Automobile Engine, engineers who designed and built it are as much technical as a SE in Google. Hence for someone who has no computer programming experience,  the correct terminology should be "Non-programmer".

author: @pikakac2441
text: Great video as always, but If you know very little about the skills he mentioned, a few months is extremely aggressive even for a da role (assuming it‚Äôs a real da role, not an Excel monkey type of role). It might be doable if you prepare full-time, have a good memory and can apply stuff you learn on projects instantly, but for an average person, it would be hard. A lot of times I find that knowing a skill and being able to apply it to a large, real-world data set are totally different.
